description: The Payment Settings SPI allows you to apply custom payment settings during the payment process of an order.
For example, you can use the SPI to require an additional layer of security to certain orders.
## Before you begin
To collect payments, a Wix site must [connect a payment provider](https://support.wix.com/en/article/connecting-a-payment-provider).
Once a payment provider is connected you may use the Payment Settings SPI to enforce additional payment settings to your site's transactions.
For example, you may require additional [3d secure payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-3d-secure-3ds-payments-with-third-party-payment-providers) (3DS)
for certain payment methods. Note that each payment provider may have specific payment settings they accept with their Wix integration.
For example, [Tranzila](https://support.wix.com/en/article/connecting-tranzila-as-a-payment-provider) is a payment provider that

supports 3DS payments, but not all payment providers offer this feature. We recommend [contacting payment providers directly](https://support.wix.com/en/article/receiving-payouts-from-third-party-payment-providers)
to confirm which payment settings they have implemented as part of their Wix integration. Currently, the only payment setting available to customize
is whether to apply 3DS to an order.
## Configuration
Adding a custom extension to your site has 3 steps:

1. [Add the extension to your site](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/coding-with-velo/integrations/custom-extensions-spis/custom-app-extensions-using-sp-is#step-1-create-a-new-extension-on-your-wix-site).
2. Update the [`getConfig()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/ecom-payment-settings/getconfig) function in the **-config.js** file that is added to your site with step 1.
3. Update the [`getPaymentSettings()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/ecom-payment-settings/getpaymentsettings) function in the **.js** file that is added to your site with step 1.
## Resources
+ See an example of implementing this SPI: [Tutorial: Payment Settings Custom Extension](https://support.wix.com/en/article/tutorial-payment-settings-custom-extension)
+ Learn more about SPIs and Velo: [Velo: Custom App Extensions Using SPIs](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-custom-business-app-extensions-using-spis-beta)
## Terminology
| Term | Definition |

| 3 Domain Security (3DS) |An additional layer of security for online credit and debit card transactions. The name refers to the "three domains" which interact using the protocol: the card issuer, the acquiring bank, and the payment gateway that facilitates the transaction. Learn more [about 3DS payments with third-party payment providers](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-3d-secure-3ds-payments-with-third-party-payment-providers). |
| Payment Providers |Different payment options available to your Wix site. Learn more about [accepting payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/accepting-payments-an-overview). |

params.name: fallbackValueForRequires3dSecure
params.doc:
The value to set for `paymentSettings.requires3dSecure` if the SPI call fails.

Default: `false`

docs.summary:
Use this function to set the custom default values for your 
[`getPaymentSettings()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/ecom-payment-settings/getpaymentsettings) function.
description: When you [add the Payment Settings custom extension](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-apps/wix-e-commerce-stores/tutorial-payment-settings-custom-extension#step-1-create-a-new-payment-settings-extension),
it automatically adds a folder to your site. This file contains 2 files, **<your-extension-name>-config.js** and
**<your-extension-name>.js**.
Use the first of these files, **<your-extension-name>-config.js**, to set any default configurations for your implementation of the custom extension.
For the payment settings extension, the available default is to set a fallback value for whether to require
3DS to an order payment if the [`getPaymentSettings()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/ecom-payment-settings/getpaymentsettings)
function fails.
When `fallbackValueForRequires3dSecure` is set to `true`, then in a case where the SPI call fails it will, by default,
return `paymentSettings.requires3dSecure` set to `true` which tells the payment provider to require 3DS for the order.
See [Tutorial: Payment Settings Custom Extension](https://support.wix.com/en/article/tutorial-payment-settings-custom-extension)
for a step-by-step tutorial.

docs.summary: Retrieves the payment settings to apply to an order based on your custom logic. Wix passes on the settings to the payment provider.
description: When you [add the Payment Settings custom extension](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-apps/wix-e-commerce-stores/tutorial-payment-settings-custom-extension#step-1-create-a-new-payment-settings-extension),
it automatically adds a folder to your site. This file contains 2 files, **<your-extension-name>-config.js** and
**<your-extension-name>.js**.
Use the second of these files, **<your-extension-name>.js**, to write the code to determine which payment settings to apply to an order.

Currently, the only payment setting available to customize is whether to apply [3 domain security](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-3d-secure-3ds-payments-with-third-party-payment-providers) (3DS)
to an order. Note that if the code fails then `requires3dSecure` sets to the value for `fallbackValueForRequires3dSecure` set in
[`getConfig()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/ecom-payment-settings/getconfig).
See [Tutorial: Payment Settings Custom Extension](https://support.wix.com/en/article/tutorial-payment-settings-custom-extension)
for a step-by-step tutorial.

examples.title: Require 3DS if the order is greater than $50
body: // Extract the subtotal price from the order, convert it to a number
// and check if the price is equal or greater than $50.
/* If the subtotal price is less than 50, the following payment settings are returned:

members.name: orderRefunded
members.doc: Additional info about order refunded activity. `activity.type` must be `ORDER_REFUNDED`.

docs.summary: Additional fees applied to the order.

members.name: code
members.doc: Additional fee's unique code for future processing.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc: Optional. Line items associated with this additional fee. If no `lineItemIds` are provided, the fee will be associated with the whole cart/checkout/order.

members.name: taxableAmount
members.doc: Taxable amount of this line item.

members.name: taxRate
members.doc: Tax rate percentage, as a decimal numeral between 0 and 1. For example, `0.13`.

members.name: totalTax
members.doc: The calculated tax, based on the `taxableAmount` and `taxRate`.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://www.iso.org/standard/72483.html) format.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street name and number).

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains apt, suite, floor.

docs.summary: An object representing a coupon applied to the order.

members.name: code
members.doc: Coupon code (used by a buyer to apply the coupon).

members.name: discountType
members.doc:
Discount type.
One of:

 + `GLOBAL`: Discount applies to entire order.
 + `SPECIFIC-ITEMS`: Discount applies to specific items.
 + `SHIPPING`: Discount applies to shipping. For example, free shipping.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc: IDs of line items discount applies to.

members.name: discountReason
members.doc:
Pre-defined discount reason (optional).

 + `ITEMS_EXCHANGE`: Exchange balance acquired as a result of items exchange.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID. Auto-created if one does not yet exist. For more information, see Contacts API.

members.name: visitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID (if site visitor is not a member).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID (if site visitor is a site member).

docs.summary: Information about the sales channel that submitted this order.

members.name: externalOrderId
members.doc: Reference to an order ID from an external system.

members.name: externalOrderUrl
members.doc: URL to the order in the external system.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Sales channel that submitted the order.

One of: `WEB`, `POS`, `EBAY`, `AMAZON`, `OTHER_PLATFORM`, `WIX_APP_STORE`, 
`WIX_INVOICES`, `BACKOFFICE_MERCHANT`, `WISH`, `CLASS_PASS`, `GLOBAL_E`

members.name: vatId
members.doc: Tax information (for Brazil only). If ID is provided, `vatId.type` must also be set, `UNSPECIFIED` is not allowed.

members.name: taxRate
members.doc: Tax rate percentage, as a decimal numeral between 0 and 1. For example, `0.13`.

members.name: taxableAmount
members.doc: Taxable amount of this line item.

members.name: totalTax
members.doc: The calculated tax, based on the `taxableAmount` and `taxRate`.

members.name: userId
members.doc: When the order was created by a Wix user on behalf of a buyer. For example, via POS (point of service).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: When the order was created by a **logged in** site visitor.

members.name: visitorId
members.doc: When the order was created by a site visitor that was **not** logged in.

members.name: appId
members.doc: When the order was created by an external application.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that created the custom activity.

members.name: type
members.doc: Custom activity type. For example, `"Ticket number set"`.

members.name: additionalData
members.doc: Additional data in key-value form. For example, `{ "Ticket number": "123456" }`.

docs.summary: An object representing a discount applied to the order.

members.name: original
members.doc: Original discount rule name (in site's default language).

members.name: translated
members.doc: Translated discount rule name according to buyer language. Defaults to `original` when not provided.

members.name: number
members.doc: Order number displayed in the site owner's dashboard (auto-generated).

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the order was created in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the order was updated in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: paymentStatus
members.doc:
Order payment status.

One of:

 + `NOT_PAID`: This can be an order made online, but not yet paid. In such cases `order.status` will be `INITIALIZED`. This status also applies when an offline order needs to be manually marked as paid. In such cases `order.status` will be `APPROVED`.
 + `PAID`: All payments associated with this order are paid.
 + `PARTIALLY_REFUNDED`: Order was refunded, but refund amount is less than order total price.
 + `FULLY_REFUNDED`: Order fully refunded. Refund amount equals total price.
 + `PENDING`: Payments received but not yet confirmed by the payment provider.
 + `PARTIALLY_PAID`: At least one payment was received and approved, covering less than total price amount.

members.name: fulfillmentStatus
members.doc:
Order fulfillment status.

One of:

 + `NOT_FULFILLED`: Order is not yet fulfilled.
 + `FULFILLED`: Order was fulfilled successfully.
 + `PARTIALLY_FULFILLED`: Order was partially fulfilled. For example, when only some of the order's items were fulfilled.

members.name: buyerLanguage
members.doc: Language for communication with the buyer. Defaults to the site language. For a site that supports multiple languages, this is the language the buyer selected.

members.name: weightUnit
members.doc:
Weight measurement unit - defaults to site's weight unit.

One of: `UNSPECIFIED_WEIGHT_UNIT`, `KG`, `LB`

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency used for the pricing of this order in [ISO-4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#list_of_ISO_4217_currency_codes) format.

members.name: taxIncludedInPrices
members.doc: Whether tax is included in line item prices.

members.name: siteLanguage
members.doc: Site language in which original values are shown.

members.name: shippingInfo
members.doc: Shipping info and selected shipping option details.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Order status.

One of:

 + `INITIALIZED`: Order was created, but not yet approved or declined.
 + `APPROVED`: Order was approved. This happens when either the online payment succeeded or the order is an offline order. Once an order is approved, many side effects are triggered. For example, holding of stock in the inventory and sending of notification emails.
 + `CANCELED`: Order was canceled by the user.

members.name: activities
members.doc: Log of updates related to the order.

members.name: channelInfo
members.doc: Information about the sales channel that submitted this order.

members.name: seenByAHuman
members.doc: Whether a human has seen the order. Set when an order is clicked on in the Business Manager.

members.name: additionalFees
members.doc: Additional fees applied to the order.

members.name: purchaseFlowId
members.doc: Persistent ID that correlates between the various eCommerce elements: cart, checkout, and order.

docs.summary: Additional info about order refunded activity. `activity.type` must be `ORDER_REFUNDED`.

members.name: manual
members.doc: Whether order was refunded manually. For example, via payment provider or using cash.

docs.summary: Shipping info and selected shipping option details.

members.name: carrierId
members.doc: App Def ID of external provider which was a source of shipping info.

members.name: code
members.doc: Unique code (or ID) of selected shipping option. For example, `usps_std_overnight`.

members.name: title
members.doc: Shipping option title. For example, `USPS Standard Overnight Delivery`, `Standard` or `First-Class Package International`.

members.name: requires3dSecure
members.doc: Whether to apply [3D Secure](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-3d-secure-3ds-payments-with-third-party-payment-providers) during the payment process.

members.name: fallbackValueForRequires3dSecure
members.doc:
The value to set for `paymentSettings.requires3dSecure` if the SPI call fails.

Default: `false`

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: Subtotal of all the line items, before discounts and before tax.

members.name: shipping
members.doc: Total shipping price, before discounts and before tax.

members.name: total
members.doc: Orderâ€™s total price after discounts and tax.

members.name: totalWithGiftCard
members.doc: Order's total price including gift card.

members.name: totalWithoutGiftCard
members.doc: Order's total price after without gift card.

members.name: totalAdditionalFees
members.doc: Total price of additional fees before tax.

members.name: totalPriceAfterTax
members.doc: Shipping price after all discounts (if any exist), and after tax.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of shipping region. For example, `Metropolitan London`, or `Outer Melbourne suburbs`.

docs.summary: Tax information (for Brazil only). If ID is provided, `vatId.type` must also be set, `UNSPECIFIED` is not allowed.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Tax type.

One of:

 + `CPF`: for individual tax payers
 + `CNPJ`: for corporations
